alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Greensville; Prince George; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 4:51PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN CHESTERFIELD...NORTHWESTERN GREENSVILLE...PRINCE GEORGE...WESTERN SUSSEX...EASTERN DINWIDDIE AND SOUTHEASTERN BRUNSWICK COUNTIES...THE CITY OF COLONIAL HEIGHTS...THE CITY OF HOPEWELL AND THE CITY OF PETERSBURG... At 451 PM EST, radar indicated strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Dinwiddie to 6 miles west of Stony Creek to near Radium. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. Winds in excess of 40 mph are possible with these storms. Locations impacted include... Petersburg, Dinwiddie, Hopewell, Colonial Heights, Disputanta, Purdy, Virginia State University, Fort Gregg-Adams, Prince George, Sussex, Jarratt, Stony Creek, Radium, Matoaca, Ettrick, Jordans Point, Carson, Dewitt, Birchett Estate, and Bufford Crossroads. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms, and may cause localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Brunswick; Dinwiddie; Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Greensville; Prince George; Sussex
